metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1526 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The TtfUtil:LocaLookup function in TtfUtil.cpp in Libgraphite in Graphite 2 1.2.4, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.6.1, incorrectly validates a size value, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted Graphite smart font.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgraphite2-3 - 1.3.5-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> probably DoS issue, CVE is referenced in blog post, but doesn't show up in detailed reports under http://www.talosintel.com/vulnerability-reports/

criterions.comment: graphite2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.5-1ubuntu1').
